page.title: 03Churches.
page.content: Whitburn Church dates back to the thirteenth century.It has a square tower with a stunted spire,which is visible as a landmark for passing ships. A weeping chancel leads the eye towards the drooping head of Christ on the cross,depicted in the east window. Outside,there are many things of interest,a Lych Gate,an Early Norman Font and a stone coffin with the shape of scissors etched into the lid. The Methodist Chapel is also well established.Its roof is supposed to resemble an upturned fishing boat. The Catholic Church has only been established in Whitburn for a relatively short time and a temporary building has recently been replaced by a permanent structure.
